meanings.definition: The study of prehistoric life through the examination of fossils.
meanings.sent1: In paleontology, scientists learn about ancient animals by looking at their fossil remains.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in paleontology to uncover the mysteries of the past.
meanings.sent3: The paleontology class had a bone to pick with the missing dinosaur skeleton.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge of paleontology was as deep as the layers of sedimentary rock.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit on paleontology brought the ancient creatures back to life.

meanings.definition: The scientific study of ancient life forms, including dinosaurs and other extinct organisms.
meanings.sent1: Paleontology helps us understand the creatures that roamed the Earth long ago.
meanings.sent2: The paleontology professor shared fascinating insights about dinosaur evolution.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the paleontology museum's collection of dinosaur bones.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for paleontology was as fierce as a T-Rex hunting for prey.
meanings.sent5: The field of paleontology continues to reveal new discoveries about our planet's history.
